alert.note: Alert for McCulloch (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS San Angelo (Central Texas San Angelo)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 19 at 5:22PM CDT until May 19 at 8:45PM CDT by NWS San Angelo
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 715 PM CDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of west central Texas, including the following counties, McCulloch and San Saba. * WHEN...Until 715 PM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 518 PM CDT, Radar showed a cluster of slow moving thunderstorms with very heavy rain in eastern McCulloch and western San Saba Counties. Rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches have already occurred across this area, and up to an additional inch of rain is expected. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. - Street flooding could occur in Rochelle, Richland Springs, and Hall. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Richland Springs, Rochelle, Sloan, Hall and Us-190 Near The Mcculloch-San Saba County Line. - This includes the following Low Water Crossings... FM 1028 crossing Corn Creek, CR 340 crossing Dry Creek, County Road 416 crossing Onion Creek, CR 340 crossing San Saba River, County Road 423 crossing Little Brady Creek, County Road 424 crossing Little Brady Creek and County Road 416 crossing Little Onion Creek. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
